content: What all IGs are profiling FHIR-Document?
I know of IPS http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-ips/
PACIO Advanced Directives http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/pacio-adi/index.html
IHE - Paramedicine Care Summary https://wiki.ihe.net/index.php/Paramedicine_Care_Summary_(PCS)
IHE - Routine Interfacility Patient Transport (RIPT) https://wiki.ihe.net/index.php/Routine_Interfacility_Patient_Transport_(RIPT)
IHE - Quality Outcome Reporting for EMS - https://wiki.ihe.net/index.php/Quality_Outcome_Reporting_for_EMS
IHE - Birth and Fetal Death Reporting Labor and Delivery Summary - https://wiki.ihe.net/index.php/Birth_and_Fetal_Death_Reporting-Labor_and_Delivery_Summary_for_Vital_Records_Profile
HL7 Vital Records Birth and Fetal Death Reporting - http://hl7.org/fhir/us/bfdr/2021Jan/index.html

Not sure about the standing of these, but here are a couple of others I have seen that have Bundle[type=document] profiles:

Electronic Case Reporting (eCR) http://hl7.org/fhir/us/ecr/
Da Vinci - Payer Coverage Decision Exchange (PCDE) http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pcde/
HL7 Pharmacist Services and Summaries (PhCP) - http://hl7.org/fhir/us/phcp/STU1/index.html
NHSN Reporting : Inpatient Medication Administration - http://hl7.org/fhir/us/nhsn-med-admin/2021May/
US Breast-Radiology - http://hl7.org/fhir/us/breast-radiology/2019Sep/

I think I got the registry.fhir.org to give me all results of IGs that have profiled Composition -- https://registry.fhir.org/results?query=%22Composition%22&latestFilter=true&fhirVersionFilter=%5B%22R4%22%5D&resourceFilter=%5B%22StructureDefinition%22%5D

(I know you know this, but for others that may happen upon this thread)
Not all IGs that profile Composition necessarily use them as documents. The Catalog IG is an example. Others might use Composition as a means to generate dynamically created documents ($document).
yes, good point. but I can't figure out a better way to find Bundle of type document... the tool is not friendly.
I have had a similar challenge looking for things in that registry.

We have in Switzerland a few IG's which profile FHIR documents, e.g.:

  • Medication Treatment Plan document, Medication Prescription document, Medication Dispense document, Pharmaceutical Advice document, Medication List document, Medication Card document http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-emed/index.html
  • Immunization Administration document, Immunization Certificate document, Vaccination Record document http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-vacd/index.html
  • Radiology Order Document http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-rad-order/index.html
  • Laboratory Order Document http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-lab-order/index.html
  • Transition of Care document http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-etoc/StructureDefinition-ch-etoc-document.html
  • Emergency Medical Service document http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-ems/document.html

Tons of stuff in Germany:
ePrescription: https://simplifier.net/erezept
eSickNote: https://simplifier.net/eau
ImmunizationRecord: https://simplifier.net/im1x0
ChildrensMedicalRecord: https://simplifier.net/uh1x0
PregancyMedicalRecord: https://simplifier.net/mp1x0
More are in the making...
Anyone working on "InformationRecipient" - any update on this? https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-13635
HL7 Australia has http://hl7.org.au/fhir/2021Aug/StructureDefinition-information-recipient.html going to national ballot soon.
Thanks Richard! - @Simone Heckmann ?

Didn't see anyone mention C-CDA on FHIR yet here
http://hl7.org/fhir/us/ccda
